messages.message: Does anyone know if log_level is getting overwritten in api-server? I have it set to info in the docker env vars (exec-ed into the docker container and confirmed that's the case), but only error level logs appear. I don't see any info logs.
cc @Badri I'm trying to see the axis agent logs (which are all info level), but not seeing any

ah ok - so we convert (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/master/webserver/api-server/start.sh#L6) log level to lowercase, but log_helper.py (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/master/shared-utils/py-utils/utils/src/instabase/config_utils/log_helper.py#L75) expects it to be uppercase. not sure how this worked in the past? @mfichman I saw you removed the use_gunicorn flag, maybe it was not going into the if statement? Have other people noticed these log level issues?
i added a line locally to uppercase the log_level in log_helper.py, and now it respects the log_level env var
